holidays.name: Superhero Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate superheroes from comic books, movies, and real life heroes who make the world a better place.
holidays.origin: Unofficial holiday popularized by fan communities and social media to honor both fictional superheroes and everyday heroes.
holidays.funFact: Did you know that April 28 was chosen because it's the birthday of notable comic book hero Superman, though interpretations vary?

holidays.name: Great Poetry Bake-Off Day
holidays.description: A quirky celebration encouraging people to combine the art of baking with poetry—write a poem inspired by your favorite baked good!
holidays.origin: Created by literary and baking enthusiasts looking to blend two beloved arts into one fun activity.
holidays.funFact: Many participants on this day have been known to bake cupcakes and write poems about them, creating delicious verses and tasty treats!

holidays.name: Sense of Smell Day
holidays.description: Dedicated to appreciating the power and magic of our olfactory senses, this day encourages sniffing out pleasant and peculiar scents all around us.
holidays.origin: Began as a quirky science awareness day to highlight the importance of smell in memory and behavior.
holidays.funFact: People can distinguish at least one trillion different scents, far more than the famous 'five senses' count!

holidays.name: International Dance for Health Day
holidays.description: An unusual but uplifting observance promoting dance as a fun way to improve physical and mental health.
holidays.origin: Established by health organizations promoting movement and dance therapy worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Dancing for just 20 minutes can boost endorphins and improve brain function, making it a great prescription for a happy day!
